intro: Crotalaria stocksii, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Crotalaria stocksii is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial in certain agricultural contexts.
